question: You find your ball in a bunker with footprints from another player around it. According to the rules of golf, are you allowed to rake the bunker before taking your shot?*

choices.text: Yes, but only if the footprints are in the direct line of play.
No, You will get 2 penalty strokes for improving the conditions affecting the stroke

explanation: Players cannot touch or rake the sand in a bunker to improve their playing conditions before a shot. Doing so incurs a two-stroke penalty in stroke play or loss of hole in match play. This ensures the ball is played as it lies, preserving the integrity and challenge of the game.
